DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether combination suprascapular axillary nerve block non-inferior conventional interscalene block ( ISB ) provide pain relief first postoperative day adult healthy patient ( age > 18 ) undergo ambulatory shoulder surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Suprascapular Axillary Blocks Versus Interscalene Block Shoulder Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Study Hypothesis : The pain relief provide combination suprascapular axillary nerve block non-inferior produce conventional interscalene block first 24hours postoperatively adult patient undergo ambulatory shoulder surgery . Intervention Comparator : Consented patient randomize receive either pre-operative ISB ( plus sham SAB subcutaneous saline ) , SAB ( plus sham ISB ) . Both group receive general anesthesia surgery . Primary Aim : To demonstrate non-inferiority pain relief produce combination treatment compare conventional treatment compare area curve postoperative pain score plot time first 24 hour postoperatively . Secondary Aims : There four secondary aim , cover efficacy ( analgesia ) safety : rest pain , quality recovery , safety , pain relief indicator . Design There multi-centre , prospective , randomize , patient assessor blind , two-arm , parallel-group , 1:1 allocation ratio , placebo-controlled , non-inferiority clinical trial compare effect SAB treatment conventional ISB treatment pain relief first postoperative 24 hour patient undergo ambulatory shoulder surgery general anesthesia . Methods Study participants The target population adult patient ( age > 18 ) presenting outpatient ( day surgery ) unilateral arthroscopic open shoulder surgery . Eligible surgical procedure : - Shoulder arthroscopy - Shoulder instability procedures 1 . Superior labrum anterior posterior repair ( SLAP ) 2 . Rotator cuff repair 3 . Bankart repair - Acromioplasty Study centre The trial conduct two academic medical centre Toronto ambulatory shoulder surgery routinely perform : Toronto Western Hospital ( TWH ) , Women 's College Hospital ( WCH ) . Preoperative management Unless allergic , patient receive acetaminophen 1 gr celecoxib 400 mg orally sips water one hour prior surgery . All block perform block room one hour surgery . Suprascapular axillary nerve block ( SAB group ) Patients allocate suprascapular axillary nerve block combination ( SAB group ) receive block sit position . The shoulder neutral position rotate 45 degree inward elbow flexed 90 degree hand rest knee . The suprascapular nerve block branch superior trunk.78After sterile skin preparation chlorhexidine , linear array transducer ( 6-13 MHz , Sonosite M-Turbo ) probe protect 3M Tegaderm® dress sterile sheath place transverse plane visualize C5 C6 root interscalene groove . These root trace distally coalesce form superior trunk . The suprascapular nerve identify emerges superior trunk , deep cervical fascia superficial middle scalene muscle . After infiltration 1 mL 1 % lidocaine , 5 cm 22 G insulate needle ( B. Braun Medical Inc. , Bethlehem , PA , USA ) insert line probe lateral-to-medial orientation towards nerve . Local anesthetic ( 20 mL 0.5 % ropivacaine ) inject 5 mL aliquot negative aspiration blood achieve circumferential spread around nerve . The axillary nerve block perform next posterior aspect operative arm . The US transducer place longitudinal plane , parallel long axis humerus shaft approximately 2cm postero-lateral part acromion posterior aspect arm . ( Figure 1 ) The neurovascular bundle encompass humeral artery , posterior circumflex artery , axillary nerve visualize lateral edge quadrangular space , deep deltoid muscle , inferior teres minor muscle , superior triceps tendon . After infiltration 1 mL 1 % lidocaine , 22G needle inserted line probe caudad orientation towards bundle . Local anesthetic ( 20 mL 0.5 % ropivacaine ) inject 5 mL aliquot negative aspiration achieve circumferential spread around bundle . Finally , maintain patient blinding , sham ISB block perform semi-sitting position use 25G needle inject 1 mL lidocaine 1 % subcutaneously . Interscalene block ( ISB group ) Local anesthetic solution ( 20 mL 0.5 % ropivacaine ) inject 5 mL aliquot negative aspiration blood achieve spread posterior C5 C6 nerve root . Subsequently , patient receive sham SAB perform sit position use 25G needle inject 1 mL lidocaine 1 % subcutaneously . Block assessment Assessment sensory block onset confirm block success do research assistant block every 5 minute , 30 minute , blunt 22G needle apply skin , compare contralateral upper extremity . General anesthesia All patient receive standardize general anesthetic . Postoperative management Discharged patient receive prescription Tylenol # 3® need , Percocet® intolerant codeine . Two-week follow-up A study follow-up phone call arrange specifically assess potential block-related neurologic symptom pain , paresthesia , dysesthesia , sensory loss , motor power weakness . Patients find symptom offer referral chronic pain clinic TWH assessment management . Data collection The study coordinator participate site use paper-based case report form ( CRF ) prepare principal investigator documentation outcome result . Subject confidentiality maintain use study ID ( relate name , date birth ) CRFs . Sample Size Investigators aim enroll total 65 patient per group , total 130 patient . Based annual number shoulder surgery perform centre , researcher plan recruit 45 patient TWH , another 85 patient WCH . Source Data Verification : Patient Electronic Record Quality Assurance & Data Checks : N/A
DOC.criteria: Consented , Englishspeaking , adult patient ( age > 18 ) American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) classification IIII BMI ≤ 30 kg/m2 Total shoulder arthroplasty clavicular surgery ( ISB provide sufficient pain relief ) Known bronchopulmonary phrenic pathology compromise respiratory function Contraindication nerve block e.g. , infection , bleed diathesis , allergy local anesthetic Existing chronic pain disorder history use ≥ 30mg oxycodone equivalent per day Preexisting neurological deficit peripheral neuropathy involve operative upper extremity Contraindication component multimodal analgesia ( acetaminophen , nonsteroidal antiinflammatory medication , oral opioid analgesic ) Pregnancy significant psychiatric condition may affect patient assessment
